articles.title: How to Upgrade Your Billing Plan
articles.content:
# Upgrading Your Plan

To upgrade your billing plan:

1. Log in to your account
2. Navigate to Settings > Billing
3. Click 'Upgrade Plan'
4. Select your desired plan (Starter, Professional, or Enterprise)
5. Enter payment information if not already on file
6. Click 'Confirm Upgrade'

## Plan Benefits

- **Starter ($49/mo)**: 5 users, 10GB storage
- **Professional ($99/mo)**: 20 users, 50GB storage, priority support
- **Enterprise ($299/mo)**: Unlimited users, 500GB storage, dedicated success manager

## Billing Cycle

Upgrades take effect immediately. You'll be charged prorated for the current billing cycle.

## Need Help?

Contact billing@example.com or chat with us.

articles.title: Understanding Your Invoice
articles.content:
# Invoice Breakdown

Your monthly invoice includes:

## Line Items

1. **Base Subscription**: Your plan's monthly fee
2. **Additional Users**: $10/user beyond plan limit
3. **Storage Overage**: $0.20/GB beyond plan limit
4. **API Calls**: $0.01 per 1000 calls (Enterprise only)

## Viewing Invoices

1. Go to Settings > Billing > Invoices
2. Click any invoice to view details
3. Download PDF for accounting purposes

## Payment Methods

We accept:
- Credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex)
- ACH transfer (Enterprise only)
- Wire transfer (Enterprise only)

## Payment Issues

If payment fails:
- We retry 3 times over 7 days
- You'll receive email notifications
- Access continues during retry period
- Account paused after final failure

articles.title: Refund Policy and Process
articles.content:
# Refund Policy

## 30-Day Money-Back Guarantee

We offer a full refund within 30 days of your first payment with no questions asked.

## Eligibility

- First-time customers: Full refund within 30 days
- Existing customers: Prorated refund for downgrades
- Annual plans: Prorated refund if cancelled within 90 days

## How to Request a Refund

1. Email billing@example.com with:
   - Account email
   - Reason for refund (optional)
   - Invoice number
2. We process refunds within 5-7 business days
3. Refund appears in 3-10 days depending on your bank

## What Happens After Refund

- Your account is downgraded to Free plan
- Data is retained for 90 days
- You can reactivate anytime

## Exceptions

- Usage-based charges (API calls, storage) are non-refundable
- Third-party add-ons follow their own refund policies

articles.title: Troubleshooting App Crashes
articles.content:
# App Crash Troubleshooting

If the app keeps crashing, try these steps in order:

## Quick Fixes (Try First)

1. **Restart the app**
   - Fully close and reopen
   - On iOS: Swipe up and close, reopen
   - On Android: Settings > Apps > Force Stop

2. **Check for updates**
   - iOS: App Store > Updates
   - Android: Play Store > My Apps
   - Desktop: Help > Check for Updates

3. **Clear app cache**
   - iOS: Settings > General > iPhone Storage > App > Offload App, then reinstall
   - Android: Settings > Apps > Clear Cache
   - Desktop: Preferences > Advanced > Clear Cache

## Advanced Troubleshooting

4. **Check device storage**
   - Need at least 500MB free space
   - Delete unused apps/photos

5. **Check internet connection**
   - Switch between WiFi and cellular
   - Test other apps

6. **Reinstall the app**
   - Delete completely
   - Restart device
   - Reinstall from store
   - Log back in

## Still Crashing?

Contact support with:
- Device model and OS version
- When crashes occur (specific action?)
- Error message if shown
- Crash logs (Settings > Help > Send Diagnostics)

articles.title: File Upload Issues and Solutions
articles.content:
# Fixing File Upload Problems

## Common Issues

### Upload Fails or Gets Stuck

1. **Check file size**
   - Max size: 100MB per file (Free/Starter)
   - Max size: 500MB per file (Pro/Enterprise)
   - Compress large files before uploading

2. **Check file type**
   - Supported: Images (JPG, PNG, GIF), Documents (PDF, DOC, XLS), Videos (MP4, MOV)
   - Blocked: Executables (.exe, .bat), Archives (.zip, .rar require extraction)

3. **Check internet connection**
   - Upload requires stable connection
   - Try switching networks
   - Use wired connection if possible

### Upload Speed is Slow

1. Upload during off-peak hours
2. Close other apps using bandwidth
3. Disable VPN temporarily
4. Try desktop app (faster than browser)

### Upload Completes but File Not Visible

1. Refresh the page/app
2. Check you're in the right folder
3. File may be processing (video conversion takes time)
4. Check your storage quota

## Browser-Specific Issues

- **Chrome**: Clear cache, disable extensions
- **Safari**: Enable cookies and JavaScript
- **Firefox**: Check privacy settings

## Still Having Issues?

Try:
- Different browser/device
- Desktop app instead of web
- Contact support with error message

articles.title: Sync Problems: Files Not Updating
articles.content:
# Fixing Sync Issues

## Symptoms

- Changes not appearing on other devices
- Files stuck in 'Syncing...'
- Old versions showing up

## Quick Fixes

1. **Check sync status**
   - Look for sync icon (cloud with arrows)
   - Green = synced, Orange = syncing, Red = error

2. **Force sync**
   - Desktop: Click sync icon > 'Sync Now'
   - Mobile: Pull down to refresh
   - Web: Refresh browser (F5 or Cmd+R)

3. **Check internet connection**
   - Sync requires active internet
   - Check firewall isn't blocking app
   - Try different network

4. **Restart sync service**
   - Desktop: Preferences > Sync > 'Restart Sync'
   - Mobile: Close and reopen app

## Advanced Troubleshooting

5. **Check storage quota**
   - Settings > Storage
   - If full, sync pauses automatically
   - Upgrade plan or delete files

6. **Clear sync cache**
   - Desktop: Preferences > Advanced > 'Clear Sync Cache'
   - This forces fresh sync (may take time)

7. **Check for conflicts**
   - Look for files with '(conflict)' in name
   - Resolve manually by keeping one version

## Preventing Sync Issues

- Don't edit same file on multiple devices simultaneously
- Keep apps updated
- Ensure stable internet
- Don't exceed storage quota

## Need Help?

Contact support with:
- Which files aren't syncing
- Device and OS version
- Sync error message if shown

articles.title: Login Issues and Password Reset
articles.content:
# Can't Log In?

## Forgot Password

1. Go to login page
2. Click 'Forgot Password?'
3. Enter your email address
4. Check email for reset link (check spam!)
5. Click link and create new password
6. Password requirements:
   - At least 8 characters
   - Include uppercase and lowercase
   - Include number and special character

## Password Reset Not Working

- Link expired (valid 1 hour) - request new one
- Check spam/junk folder
- Make sure using email associated with account
- Try different browser

## Other Login Issues

### "Invalid credentials" Error

1. Double-check email spelling
2. Check Caps Lock isn't on
3. Try copying/pasting password
4. Reset password if unsure

### Account Locked

- Too many failed attempts lock account for 30 minutes
- Or reset password to unlock immediately

### Two-Factor Authentication Issues

1. **Not receiving codes**
   - Check phone signal
   - Use backup codes (saved during 2FA setup)
   - Contact support to disable 2FA temporarily

2. **Code not working**
   - Make sure device time is correct
   - Use most recent code
   - Each code valid for 30 seconds

## Browser Issues

- Clear cookies and cache
- Try incognito/private mode
- Disable browser extensions
- Try different browser

## Still Can't Login?

Contact support@example.com with:
- Your account email
- Description of error
- Screenshot if possible

articles.title: Inviting Team Members and Managing Permissions
articles.content:
# Team Collaboration

## Inviting Team Members

### Step-by-Step

1. Go to Settings > Team
2. Click 'Invite Member'
3. Enter email address
4. Select role:
   - **Admin**: Full access, billing, user management
   - **Member**: Create/edit content, limited settings
   - **Guest**: View only, limited folders
5. Click 'Send Invitation'

### Bulk Invitations

- Click 'Bulk Invite'
- Upload CSV with emails
- Or paste comma-separated list
- All will get same role initially

## Managing Team Members

### Change Role
1. Settings > Team
2. Find member
3. Click role dropdown
4. Select new role

### Remove Member
1. Settings > Team
2. Click '...' menu
3. Select 'Remove from team'
4. Their files remain, access revoked

## Permissions System

### Role Comparison

| Feature | Guest | Member | Admin |
|---------|-------|--------|-------|
| View files | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Edit files | ✗ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Create files | ✗ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Delete files | ✗ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Invite users | ✗ | ✗ | ✓ |
| Billing access | ✗ | ✗ | ✓ |
| Integration settings | ✗ | ✗ | ✓ |

### Folder Permissions

- Set custom permissions per folder
- Right-click folder > 'Sharing'
- Override default role permissions

## Best Practices

1. **Principle of Least Privilege**
   - Give minimum access needed
   - Use Guest role for external collaborators

2. **Regular Audits**
   - Review team list quarterly
   - Remove inactive members

3. **Onboarding**
   - Create onboarding folder with guides
   - Set up templates for common tasks

## Plan Limits

- **Free**: 3 members
- **Starter**: 5 members
- **Professional**: 20 members
- **Enterprise**: Unlimited

Need more seats? Upgrade your plan!

articles.title: Export Your Data
articles.content:
# Data Export Guide

## Why Export?

- Backup your data
- Move to another service
- Compliance/legal requirements
- Analysis in other tools

## What Can Be Exported?

- All documents and files
- Comments and annotations
- Team and permission settings
- Activity logs
- User profiles

## How to Export

### Full Account Export

1. Go to Settings > Data & Privacy
2. Click 'Export Data'
3. Select what to include:
   - [ ] All files
   - [ ] Comments
   - [ ] Activity logs
   - [ ] Team data
4. Choose format:
   - ZIP archive (all files)
   - JSON (metadata)
   - CSV (structured data)
5. Click 'Start Export'
6. You'll receive email when ready (can take hours for large accounts)
7. Download within 7 days (link expires)

### Selective Export

**Single File**
- Right-click file > 'Download'
- Or File menu > 'Export As...'

**Folder**
- Right-click folder > 'Download as ZIP'

**Multiple Files**
- Select files (Ctrl/Cmd + click)
- Right-click > 'Download Selected'

## Export Formats

### Documents
- Native format (e.g., .docx, .pdf)
- PDF (with annotations)
- Plain text (.txt)

### Data
- JSON (machine-readable)
- CSV (spreadsheet-compatible)
- HTML (browsable archive)

## Important Notes

⚠️ **Large Exports**
- Over 10GB may take 24+ hours
- Split into multiple smaller exports if needed

⚠️ **Privacy**
- Exports include everything you have access to
- Don't share export files carelessly

⚠️ **Encryption**
- Exports are NOT encrypted
- Encrypt ZIP file yourself if needed

## After Export

- Files in original formats
- Folder structure preserved
- Metadata included in JSON
- Import to other tools or archive

## Automated Backups (Enterprise)

- Schedule daily/weekly exports
- Auto-upload to your S3/Drive
- Contact sales for setup

## Need Help?

Contact support if:
- Export fails
- Download link expired
- Need specific format
- Have compliance questions

articles.title: API Authentication Guide
articles.content:
# API Authentication

## Getting Started

Our API uses API keys for authentication. All requests must include your API key.

## Creating an API Key

1. Go to Settings > Developers > API Keys
2. Click 'Create New Key'
3. Give it a descriptive name (e.g., 'Mobile App Production')
4. Select scopes:
   - `read`: Read data
   - `write`: Create/update data
   - `delete`: Delete data
   - `admin`: User management, billing
5. Click 'Create'
6. **Copy the key immediately** - you can't view it again!
7. Store securely (use environment variables, never commit to git)

## Using Your API Key

### HTTP Header (Recommended)

```bash
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
     https://api.example.com/v1/documents
```

### Query Parameter (Not Recommended)

```bash
curl https://api.example.com/v1/documents?api_key=YOUR_API_KEY
```

## Key Management Best Practices

### Security

1. **Use environment variables**
   ```bash
   export API_KEY="sk_live_..."
   ```

2. **Rotate keys regularly**
   - Create new key
   - Update applications
   - Delete old key
   - Do every 90 days

3. **Use different keys per environment**
   - Development: `sk_dev_...`
   - Staging: `sk_stage_...`
   - Production: `sk_live_...`

4. **Least privilege**
   - Only grant necessary scopes
   - Use read-only keys when possible

### Monitoring

- View API key usage: Settings > Developers > API Keys
- See last used timestamp
- Monitor for unusual activity
- Set up alerts for high usage

## Revoking Keys

If key is compromised:

1. Immediately revoke: Settings > Developers > API Keys > Delete
2. Create new key with different name
3. Update applications
4. Monitor for unauthorized access

## Rate Limits

- **Free/Starter**: 100 requests/hour
- **Professional**: 1,000 requests/hour
- **Enterprise**: 10,000 requests/hour

Exceeding limit returns `429 Too Many Requests`.

Response headers:
```
X-RateLimit-Limit: 1000
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 999
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1609459200
```

## OAuth 2.0 (Enterprise)

For user-facing integrations:

1. Register OAuth application
2. Get client_id and client_secret
3. Implement OAuth flow
4. See docs: https://docs.example.com/api/oauth

## Troubleshooting

### 401 Unauthorized

- Check key is correct (no spaces/typos)
- Verify key isn't revoked
- Check Authorization header format

### 403 Forbidden

- Key doesn't have required scope
- Create new key with correct scopes

### 429 Too Many Requests

- Slow down requests
- Implement exponential backoff
- Upgrade plan for higher limits

## API Documentation

Full API docs: https://docs.example.com/api/reference

articles.title: Webhook Setup and Troubleshooting
articles.content:
# Webhooks Guide

## What are Webhooks?

Webhooks notify your application when events happen in your account.

**Example Use Cases:**
- Send Slack notification when file uploaded
- Trigger CI/CD pipeline on changes
- Sync data to external database
- Auto-create tasks in project management tool

## Setting Up Webhooks

### 1. Create Webhook Endpoint

Your server must:
- Accept POST requests
- Return 200 OK within 5 seconds
- Handle JSON payloads

```python
# Example Flask endpoint
@app.route('/webhooks/example', methods=['POST'])
def handle_webhook():
    payload = request.json
    event_type = payload['event']
    
    if event_type == 'file.created':
        # Handle new file
        process_file(payload['data'])
    
    return '', 200
```

### 2. Register Webhook

1. Go to Settings > Developers > Webhooks
2. Click 'Add Webhook'
3. Enter:
   - **URL**: Your endpoint (must be HTTPS)
   - **Events**: Select events to receive
   - **Secret**: Auto-generated (for signature verification)
4. Click 'Create'

### 3. Verify Signatures

**Important**: Always verify webhook signatures!

```python
import hmac
import hashlib

def verify_webhook(payload, signature, secret):
    expected = hmac.new(
        secret.encode(),
        payload.encode(),
        hashlib.sha256
    ).hexdigest()
    
    return hmac.compare_digest(expected, signature)

# In your handler
signature = request.headers.get('X-Webhook-Signature')
if not verify_webhook(request.data, signature, WEBHOOK_SECRET):
    return 'Invalid signature', 401
```

## Available Events

### Files
- `file.created`: New file uploaded
- `file.updated`: File content changed
- `file.deleted`: File deleted
- `file.shared`: File shared with user

### Users
- `user.created`: New team member added
- `user.updated`: User profile changed
- `user.deleted`: User removed from team

### Comments
- `comment.created`: New comment added
- `comment.updated`: Comment edited
- `comment.resolved`: Comment marked resolved

## Payload Format

```json
{
  "event": "file.created",
  "timestamp": "2025-11-18T10:30:00Z",
  "data": {
    "id": "file_123",
    "name": "report.pdf",
    "size": 1048576,
    "created_by": "user_456",
    "folder": "folder_789"
  }
}
```

## Troubleshooting

### Webhook Not Firing

1. **Check event selection**
   - Verify event is enabled in settings
   
2. **Test webhook manually**
   - Settings > Webhooks > Test
   - Check if endpoint receives request

3. **Check webhook status**
   - View delivery history
   - See error messages

### Deliveries Failing

**Common Issues:**

1. **Endpoint returns error**
   - Must return 2xx status
   - Check your server logs

2. **Timeout (5 seconds)**
   - Process asynchronously
   - Return 200 immediately
   - Queue work for background processing

3. **SSL certificate issues**
   - Use valid HTTPS certificate
   - No self-signed certificates

4. **Firewall blocking**
   - Whitelist our IPs: 52.1.2.3, 52.1.2.4
   - Check cloud firewall rules

## Retry Behavior

If delivery fails:
- Retry immediately
- Then after 1 minute
- Then after 5 minutes
- Then after 30 minutes
- Then disable webhook after 10 failures

## Best Practices

1. **Idempotency**
   - Webhooks may be delivered multiple times
   - Track event IDs to prevent duplicate processing

2. **Asynchronous Processing**
   ```python
   @app.route('/webhook', methods=['POST'])
   def webhook():
       payload = request.json
       
       # Queue for background processing
       queue.enqueue(process_webhook, payload)
       
       # Return immediately
       return '', 200
   ```

3. **Security**
   - Always verify signatures
   - Use HTTPS only
   - Rotate webhook secrets periodically

4. **Monitoring**
   - Log all webhook deliveries
   - Alert on high failure rate
   - Monitor processing time

## Testing Webhooks

### Local Development

Use ngrok to expose local server:

```bash
ngrok http 3000
# Use the https URL in webhook settings
```

### Request Bin

Test payload format:
1. Create RequestBin: https://requestbin.com
2. Use bin URL as webhook endpoint
3. Trigger event
4. View payload in bin

## Need Help?

Contact support@example.com with:
- Webhook ID
- Delivery history screenshot
- Your endpoint logs

articles.title: Rate Limits and Best Practices
articles.content:
# API Rate Limits

## Current Limits

| Plan | Requests/Hour | Burst | Concurrent |
|------|---------------|-------|------------|
| Free | 100 | 10 | 2 |
| Starter | 500 | 25 | 5 |
| Professional | 5,000 | 100 | 20 |
| Enterprise | 50,000 | 500 | 100 |

**Burst**: Max requests in 1 minute
**Concurrent**: Max simultaneous requests

## Rate Limit Headers

Every API response includes:

```
X-RateLimit-Limit: 5000
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 4950
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1700320800
```

- `Limit`: Total requests allowed per hour
- `Remaining`: Requests left in current window
- `Reset`: Unix timestamp when limit resets

## Handling Rate Limits

### Check Before Request

```python
import time
import requests

def api_call(url, headers):
    response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    
    # Check if approaching limit
    remaining = int(response.headers.get('X-RateLimit-Remaining', 0))
    if remaining < 10:
        reset_time = int(response.headers.get('X-RateLimit-Reset', 0))
        wait_seconds = reset_time - time.time()
        if wait_seconds > 0:
            print(f'Approaching limit, waiting {wait_seconds}s')
            time.sleep(wait_seconds)
    
    return response
```

### Handle 429 Response

```python
def api_call_with_retry(url, headers, max_retries=3):
    for i in range(max_retries):
        response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
        
        if response.status_code == 429:
            # Rate limited - exponential backoff
            retry_after = int(response.headers.get('Retry-After', 60))
            wait_time = min(retry_after * (2 ** i), 300)  # Max 5 min
            print(f'Rate limited, waiting {wait_time}s')
            time.sleep(wait_time)
            continue
        
        return response
    
    raise Exception('Max retries exceeded')
```

## Best Practices

### 1. Implement Exponential Backoff

```python
def exponential_backoff(attempt):
    # 2^attempt seconds, max 60 seconds
    return min(2 ** attempt, 60)
```

### 2. Cache Responses

```python
from functools import lru_cache
import time

@lru_cache(maxsize=1000)
def get_user_cached(user_id, cache_time):
    # cache_time changes every 5 minutes
    return api.get_user(user_id)

# Use it
cache_time = int(time.time() / 300)  # 5-minute buckets
user = get_user_cached('user_123', cache_time)
```

### 3. Batch Requests

Instead of:
```python
for file_id in file_ids:
    file = api.get_file(file_id)  # 100 requests!
```

Use batch endpoint:
```python
files = api.batch_get_files(file_ids)  # 1 request
```

### 4. Use Webhooks

Instead of polling:
```python
while True:
    changes = api.get_changes()  # Every minute = 1440 requests/day
    time.sleep(60)
```

Use webhooks:
```python
@app.route('/webhook', methods=['POST'])
def handle_change():
    # Notified immediately, 0 polling requests
    process_change(request.json)
```

### 5. Request Only What You Need

**Use field filtering:**
```
GET /files/123?fields=id,name,size
# vs
GET /files/123  # Returns all fields
```

**Use pagination:**
```
GET /files?limit=20&page=1
# vs
GET /files  # Returns all files
```

## Avoiding Rate Limits

### Optimize Request Patterns

❌ **Bad**: Sequential requests
```python
for user in users:
    profile = api.get_profile(user.id)
    files = api.get_files(user.id)
```

✅ **Good**: Parallel batch requests
```python
profiles = api.batch_get_profiles([u.id for u in users])
files = api.batch_get_files([u.id for u in users])
```

### Use Conditional Requests

```python
# First request
response = api.get_file('123')
etag = response.headers['ETag']

# Subsequent requests
response = api.get_file('123', headers={'If-None-Match': etag})
if response.status_code == 304:
    # Not modified, use cached version
    # This request doesn't count against rate limit!
```

## Monitoring Usage

### View in Dashboard

1. Settings > Developers > API Usage
2. See:
   - Requests today/this hour
   - By endpoint
   - By API key
   - Error rates

### Set Up Alerts

1. Settings > Developers > Alerts
2. Notify when:
   - 80% of limit reached
   - 429 errors occur
   - Specific endpoint errors

## Increasing Limits

### Temporary Increase

Contact support for special events:
- Data migration
- Black Friday traffic
- Product launch

Provide:
- Reason
- Duration needed
- Expected request volume

### Permanent Increase

- Upgrade to higher plan
- Or contact sales for custom limits

## Need Help?

Contact api-support@example.com with:
- Your API key (first 8 characters only)
- Endpoint being called
- Current requests/hour
- Desired requests/hour

articles.title: Enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
articles.content:
# Two-Factor Authentication Setup

## Why Enable 2FA?

Adds extra security layer:
- Protects against password theft
- Required for compliance (SOC 2, GDPR)
- Prevents unauthorized access
- Required for Admin/Enterprise accounts

## Setting Up 2FA

### Step 1: Choose Method

We support:
1. **Authenticator App** (Recommended)
   - Google Authenticator
   - Authy
   - Microsoft Authenticator
   - 1Password

2. **SMS** (Less secure, but convenient)
   - Text message to your phone

### Step 2: Enable 2FA

1. Go to Settings > Security
2. Click 'Enable Two-Factor Authentication'
3. Choose method

**For Authenticator App:**
1. Open your authenticator app
2. Scan QR code shown on screen
3. Enter 6-digit code from app
4. Click 'Verify and Enable'

**For SMS:**
1. Enter phone number
2. Receive verification code via SMS
3. Enter code
4. Click 'Verify and Enable'

### Step 3: Save Backup Codes

⚠️ **CRITICAL**: Save backup codes!

- You'll see 10 one-time backup codes
- Each can be used once if you lose your device
- Download or print them
- Store securely (password manager, safe)

## Using 2FA

When logging in:

1. Enter email and password (as usual)
2. You'll be prompted for 2FA code
3. Enter:
   - 6-digit code from authenticator app
   - Or code received via SMS
   - Or one backup code
4. Click 'Verify'

**"Trust this device"**
- Check box to skip 2FA for 30 days on this device
- Only use on personal devices
- Don't use on shared/public computers

## Troubleshooting

### Code Not Working

1. **Check time sync**
   - Authenticator apps require accurate time
   - iOS: Settings > General > Date & Time > Auto
   - Android: Settings > System > Date & Time > Automatic

2. **Use most recent code**
   - Codes expire every 30 seconds
   - Wait for new code if near expiration

3. **Check account**
   - Make sure using right account in authenticator
   - Scan QR code again if unsure

### Lost Phone/Device

1. **Use backup code**
   - Enter one of your saved backup codes
   - Each code works once

2. **Contact support**
   - If no backup codes, email support@example.com
   - Provide:
     - Account email
     - Recent activity (to verify identity)
   - We'll temporarily disable 2FA
   - Set up again immediately after logging in

### SMS Not Arriving

1. Check phone signal
2. Check number is correct
3. Wait 5 minutes and try again
4. Use backup code instead
5. Switch to authenticator app method

### Changed Phone Number

1. Log in (with old number 2FA)
2. Settings > Security
3. Click 'Change 2FA Method'
4. Set up with new number
5. Save new backup codes

## Managing 2FA

### Regenerate Backup Codes

1. Settings > Security
2. Click 'Regenerate Backup Codes'
3. **Old codes stop working**
4. Save new codes

### Change 2FA Method

1. Settings > Security
2. Click 'Change 2FA Method'
3. Verify with current method
4. Set up new method

### Disable 2FA

1. Settings > Security
2. Click 'Disable 2FA'
3. Verify with current method
4. Click 'Confirm Disable'

⚠️ **Not recommended** unless switching to other account.

## Team Enforcement (Admin)

Require 2FA for all team members:

1. Settings > Team > Security Policies
2. Enable 'Require 2FA for all users'
3. Set grace period (7-30 days)
4. Users must enable 2FA or lose access

**Enforcement Levels:**
- **Recommended**: Users see banner
- **Required for Admins**: Only admins must enable
- **Required for All**: Everyone must enable

## Best Practices

1. **Use Authenticator App**
   - More secure than SMS
   - Works without cell signal

2. **Backup Your Backup Codes**
   - Save in password manager
   - Print and store in safe
   - Don't email them

3. **Multiple Devices**
   - Add 2FA to multiple devices
   - Scan same QR code on backup phone/tablet

4. **Review Trusted Devices**
   - Settings > Security > Trusted Devices
   - Remove old/lost devices

## Need Help?

Contact security@example.com if:
- Locked out without backup codes
- Suspect account compromise
- Need to enforce 2FA for team

articles.title: Managing Team Roles and Permissions
articles.content:
# Team Roles & Permissions

## Role Overview

We have 4 built-in roles:

### 1. Owner (1 per account)

**Full Control:**
- All Admin permissions
- Transfer ownership
- Delete account
- Cannot be removed

### 2. Admin

**Management:**
- Manage users (invite, remove, change roles)
- Billing and subscription
- Integration settings
- Security policies
- API keys and webhooks
- View audit logs

**Content:**
- Full access to all files/folders
- Create, edit, delete anything
- Share externally

### 3. Member

**Content:**
- Create and edit own files
- View team files (unless restricted)
- Comment on files
- Share files (if enabled)

**Limited:**
- Cannot manage users
- Cannot access billing
- Cannot change settings
- Cannot view audit logs

### 4. Guest

**Restricted:**
- Access only to shared files/folders
- View and comment only
- Cannot create files
- Cannot share
- Cannot see team directory

**Use For:**
- External collaborators
- Contractors
- Clients

## Permission Matrix

| Permission | Owner | Admin | Member | Guest |
|------------|-------|-------|--------|-------|
| View own files | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| View team files | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | Shared only |
| Create files | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ |
| Edit own files | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ |
| Edit team files | ✓ | ✓ | If permitted | ✗ |
| Delete files | ✓ | ✓ | Own only | ✗ |
| Share externally | ✓ | ✓ | If enabled | ✗ |
| Comment | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Invite users | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Remove users | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Change user roles | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Billing access | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Integration settings | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| API key creation | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| View audit logs | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Security policies | ✓ | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |
| Delete account | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ | ✗ |

## Changing User Roles

### As Admin/Owner

1. Settings > Team
2. Find user
3. Click role dropdown
4. Select new role
5. Click 'Save'

**Restrictions:**
- Cannot change Owner
- Need at least 1 Admin
- Guest → Member upgrade counts toward seat limit

## Custom Permissions

### Folder-Level Permissions

Override role permissions for specific folders:

1. Right-click folder
2. Select 'Permissions'
3. Add users/groups
4. Set permission level:
   - **View**: Read-only
   - **Comment**: View + comment
   - **Edit**: View + edit files
   - **Manage**: Edit + add/remove files

**Inheritance:**
- Subfolders inherit parent permissions
- Can override for specific subfolder

### Member Restrictions

Control what Members can do (Settings > Team > Policies):

- [ ] Share files externally
- [ ] Create public links
- [ ] Invite guests
- [ ] Export data
- [ ] Delete files
- [ ] Install integrations

## Groups (Professional+)

Organize users into groups:

### Creating Groups

1. Settings > Team > Groups
2. Click 'Create Group'
3. Name it (e.g., "Marketing", "Developers")
4. Add members
5. Set group permissions

### Using Groups

- Share folders with entire group
- Apply permissions to group
- Manage members in one place

**Benefits:**
- Easier permission management
- Consistent access control
- Onboarding automation

## Best Practices

### 1. Principle of Least Privilege

- Give minimum access needed
- Start with Member, upgrade if needed
- Use Guest for external people

### 2. Regular Audits

Quarterly:
- Review all users
- Remove inactive accounts
- Audit Admin list
- Check external shares

### 3. Offboarding

When someone leaves:
1. Remove from team
2. Transfer file ownership
3. Revoke external shares
4. Remove from groups
5. Disable API keys

### 4. Admin Security

- Limit Admin role to essential people
- Require 2FA for Admins
- Monitor Admin activity in audit logs

## Transferring Ownership

### Steps (Owner Only)

1. Settings > Team
2. Find user to make Owner
3. Click '...' > 'Transfer Ownership'
4. Confirm with password
5. **You become Admin**
6. New Owner can remove you

⚠️ **Cannot be undone** without new Owner's consent.

## Compliance

### GDPR/Privacy

- View who has access: Right-click file > 'Access List'
- Export user list: Settings > Team > Export
- Audit access: Settings > Security > Audit Logs

### SOC 2

- Require 2FA: Settings > Team > Security Policies
- Session timeout: Settings > Security > Session Management
- Monitor access: Review audit logs regularly

## Troubleshooting

### "You don't have permission"

1. Check your role (Settings > Team)
2. Check folder permissions (if specific folder)
3. Contact Admin to grant access

### Can't Change User Role

- Need Admin or Owner role
- Cannot change Owner
- Member limit may be reached

### Guest Can't Access File

1. File must be explicitly shared with Guest
2. Share link may have expired
3. Guest email must match invitation

## Need Help?

Contact support with:
- Your role
- User email having issue
- Specific action that failed
- Screenshot of error
